text: pinprick the velvet-black sky that stretches over a vast sleeping jungle. A fingernail moon silvers the whispering canopy while gentle tendrils of steam rise. TITLE ON SCREEN: REPUBLIC OF CONGO, AFRICA.

CAMERA DRIFTS ACROSS the eternity of treetops until it FI A BUNGALOW. It's 20x20 square, with a wraparound porch and simple woo shutters. The structure is hidden in a clearing that's be crudely hacked out of the sweaty wilderness.

Two beds draped in mosquito nets sit on opposite sides of space. A TEEN BOY sleeps in one and a MIDDLE-AGED MAN lie in the other. Their ebony skin glistens in the swampy hea The numbing THROB OF INSECTS fills the silence until THE DOOR SOFTLY RATTLES. The Teen's eyes fly open. Fear grips his face as he looks over at the Man, who is now upright and awake. They hold their breath, listening over the DRUMMING CHORUS. ANOTHER RATTLE. It's louder this time. Unmistakable. The Teen watches as the Man pulls a crystal-handled dagger from under his pil and stealthily creeps to the door. The Man cautiously lea in and peers through the bamboo slats. WHAT HE SEES: The empty porch. No sign of life. Relieved, he turns back, opens his mouth to speak when hi face contorts. He looks down and sees the tip of
protruding from his chest. As the sword is viciously protracted through the door, the Man meets the Teen's hau eyes and whispers his last, desperate word...
Run!

The Teen's naked feet pound the hot, wet earth as he spri through the maze of trees. Flecks of moonlight ricochet o the crystal pendant that dangles around his neck. He move impossibly fast. Faster than any human could.

ECHOES as something otherworldly catches his scent and be thrashing in pursuit. The Teen's face tightens with dread and the SHOUTS of his pursuers hammer his ears. He doesn't look back, willing himself to survive. He race up a verge and fearlessly launches himself off the edge o

GOD SHOT LOOKING DOWN as the Teen leaps across the abyss. kicks air as he arcs and finally touches down on the oppo lip. Chest heaving, he sees the hideous silhouette of A HULKING BEAST. It's called a Piken and skitters to a stop on the other s It utters a chilling BANSHEE WAIL of frustration. Relieve the Teen turns to make his escape when

wraps around his throat. He is effortlessly hoisted by a TOWERING MAN with skin as cold and pale as alabaster. THIS IS A MOGADORIAN. He wears the long red coat of a Commander. We catch the briefest glimpse of his cruel magenta eyes as they scan t geometric symbol engraved on the Teen's pendant. Silhouet against the giant jungle moon, he triumphantly raises A SWORD. Its serrated blade ignites with silver flame as it sweeps towards the Teen. The boy's DEATH CRY echoes as the CAMER ZEROES IN ON the pendant that glows brilliant-bright.

It glimmers to life on the ankle of another TEEN 10,000 m away. His name's DANIEL and he's in the middle of a wild ski race with TWO BUDDIES. TITLE ON SCREEN: BIG PINE KEY, FLORIDA, USA. 3. The trio crisscrosses the turquoise sea while a party rag on the beach. Daniel makes a kamikaze move, whips his jet ski past his opponents and victoriously pumps his fist. But his moment triumph is cut short. His face contorts in agony as he fe
searing into his skin. As he leans forward to grip his ankle, he cartwheels off the jet ski and viciously body-s across the water.
LOOKING UP as Daniel crashes into view. Needles of light flicker from the symbol. It's cauterizing into his flesh like a brand.
Daniel stumbles through the surf and collapses onto the s clutching his ankle. He rolls onto his side as a CROWD OF PARTYING TEENS gathers. A BLONDE GIRL leans down to help.
Daniel, what's wrong? Did you break your ankle? But as she turns him over, she sees the light leaking fro between his fingers and reels back.
Oh my God. He stares up into the crowd's fearful faces, then stagger his feet and takes off running.
The busy road runs parallel to an expanse of ancient pine Through the trees, we CATCH THE SHUTTER IMAGE of a figure outrunning the hurtling vehicles.

Trees whip past as Daniel sprints down a sandy track. The pendant that knocks against his chest was carved by the s hand as the African Teen's, but the symbol is unique. He peels off to the right and bursts out onto a long drive.
sits at the end. It's cake-frosting pink and is built rig on the edge of a coral-white beach. 4.

The door flies open and Daniel stands on the threshold. HENRI looks up from his bank of laptops that scroll with feeds. He is decades older than his suntanned face betray and you'd be way off if you guessed his accent was French

Number 3 is dead. Henri's eyes narrow with urgency. He is immediately on hi feet, he kneels at Daniel's side and studies the symbol o the teen's ankle. It has stopped glowing but is painfully raw. Directly below this fresh wound are TWO OTHER GEOMETRIC BRANDS. They are the same size, but each symbol is subtly differe Time has transformed them into raised, snake-smooth scars Henri's penetrating eyes look up at the shell-shocked tee
Did anybody else see this? OFF Daniel's panicked nod...

skitters across the ceiling, its glossy black eyes watch Daniel frantically stuffs his clothes into a duffel bag. walls are bare. No photos, no posters, no personality. Henri enters, holding a crate of computer cables.
Taillights in five minutes. What we can't carry --
-- we burn. I know the drill.

TIGHT ON A BOX. It's exquisitely carved and inlaid with a intricate geometric design. Henri carefully hides it under the driver's seat of an ol Jeep Wagoneer. It's the kind with wooden trim. He looks a Daniel who feeds homework assignments into a roaring FIRE

Time to go. 5. Daniel clicks the SIM card from his cell phone, snaps it two and drops it into the fire. Bitter, he takes one last look at the glittering azure sea, then climbs into the Je As the engine HUMS to life, CAMERA FOLLOWS THE GECKO. It darts up the fender, squeezes into the jamb of the tru and Houdinis into the vehicle with a flick of its tail.
The Jeep powers across the long elevated bridge. The dyin sun tints the clouds and the sky in violent apocalyptic h

This is the part I hate the most. The running. But it's the only thing in my life that's real. The rest is a lie. My name. My birthday. Even Henri. People think he's my father. He's not. His job is to keep me alive.
Henri's eyes scan the rear view, on constant vigil. The speedometer never brushes past 60. Daniel has his head against the window, brooding, listening to an iPod.
We are hiding from the Mogadorians. A brutal race that wiped out our entire planet, Lorien.
Plastic flags whip overhead. Daniel leans against a silve SUV and watches Henri negotiate with the DEALER.
Only nine children escaped the genocide. We were each given a number and sent here to hide. I don't know where the others are. I only know when one of them is murdered.
Daniel sits on the edge of a bathtub. He gently unwraps t bandage that covers his ankle and fearfully inspects the scab that has formed over the wound. 6.

I got the first scar when I was eight. I woke up screaming. We lived in Vermont. The second was on a Tilt-a-Whirl at a fair in Michigan. I was 12. Yesterday was the third. His finger traces the lines of the other two scars.
The lush tropical landscape has browned into flat, dorman farmland. The silver SUV charges through the bleak monoto
Because of the spell our Elders cast, the Mogs can only kill us in order. That's the reason I've survived this long. But our enemy is relentless.
Daniel is asleep with his earphones on. Henri glances ove his mask of certainty momentarily slips. He looks like a soldier heading into a battle he knows cannot be won.
Now their hunt has turned to me. I am number 4.
A tired neon sign illuminates the big rigs that RUMBLE pa headed to destinations unknown.
Daniel sullenly stares at a stack of untouched pancakes. Henri slides into the booth, all business.
Florida's clear. I sent a letter to the school and there's nothing in the papers.
I didn't even get a chance to say goodbye. Henri keeps going, passes an envelope across the table. 7.
New IDs. Daniel pulls out his birth certificate, reads the name.
Just when I think you can't get any less original, you lower the bar.

I'm not interested in originality. I'm interested in untraceable. There are 335,321 John Smiths in the United States. (Note: from this point on, Daniel will be called John.) John looks at him, then abruptly gets up and storms away. Henri drops $20 on the table and calmly heads after him.
A row of ancient arcade games blinks. John angrily stabs buttons of a Space Invaders machine as Henri approaches. They are alone. John's eyes never leave the video screen.
It's been so long since the last scar.
You got lulled into a false sense of security. That's my fault. John struggles to keep his temper in check.
I liked Florida. I liked having friends. I liked feeling normal. Henri's face softens with paternal compassion.
I wish that you could have a normal life -- but you can't. Only now does John turn and face him. His eyes blaze with frustration.
Then why fake it? Why not just go hole up in the wilderness.
That's exactly what Number 3 did. 8. John looks at him, confused. Henri pulls up an article on his iPhone and hands it to John.
It's from an African news site. A man and his son went missing two nights ago. The locals think they were taken by strange beasts. John understands the implication.
Piken.
The Mogadorians are natural-born hunters. Blending in is our best protection.
So we just keep moving from town to town?
Until I say otherwise -- yes. John waits as a TRUCKER passes through the room. His voic softens but never loses its intensity.
I want to be from someplace, Henri.
You are.
Lorien's your home, I don't even remember it. John's tone rubs Henri the wrong way.
Like it or not, it's your home too. You have a responsibility to those who died.
Henri and John climb in.
I want a say in where we live. (off Henri's face) You already picked it, didn't you? 9. Henri REVS the ENGINE to life.
Cheer up, you're going to be living in Paradise.

A frigid sheet of RAIN POUNDS the sign that's planted on side of this narrow stretch of rural blacktop: aWELCOME TO PARADISE, OHIO. POP. 5,243a The silver SUV streaks past, its wipers working overtime. kicks up a spray as it speeds down Main Street. The dinky storefronts are garishly decorated for Halloween.
The leaves are washed in a thousand shades of gold. The S barrels along the drive that twists through the woods.
Henri pulls up in front of a small house. It sits by itse surrounded by trees. Water sluices off the weather-worn garage in the yard behind it. A WOMAN steps out of a mini to greet them.
She looks even perkier than the realtor in Florida. A warm smile graces her round face and she's clutching a fruit basket. For the record, she is called ANNIE.
What's your name?
John Smith.
Where are you from, John?
Arizona.
Why did you move to Paradise?
Because you're an asshole. John waits for a reaction but doesn't get one... 10.
Because my dad needs peace and quiet to research his book. Henri nods and smiles wryly.
This was a lot easier when you were 12.
The front door swings open and Annie proudly escorts Henr and John inside.

Here we are. Home sweet home. They scan the faded interior. The place is in desperate n of a makeover. A grandfather clock pensively TICKS at the end of the hall. Annie remains relentlessly optimistic.
First impressions?
It's perfect. Annie places the fruit basket on the dining table and beg turning on the lights.
That's one word for it. Stewing, John exits into the hall with his duffel bag. An reads the strained dynamic.
I feel your pain. I have a daughter his age. Apparently, I ruin her life on a daily basis. John steps back in, holding a sun-faded poster featuring great Bernie Kosar.
This guy was covering a hole in my wall. Annie's cheeks blush with annoyance.
I told the handyman to patch that before you arrived. I'm so sorry. 11. Henri is all charm, gently leads her to the front door.
Don't you worry about it. She nods, grateful.
We'll knock it off the rent. Keep the poster, Bernie Kosar brings good luck here in the Buckeye State.
The rain has stopped. The wind RUSTLES the trees. John lifts out the last box. As he closes the trunk, he doesn' notice the hitchhiking gecko hotfoot it out.
Henri is busy setting up his computer station. John dumps the box on the floor.
That's the last of them. I'm hitting the sack.
I need a new photo first. John crosses and stands against the wall.

Say Paradise. John gives him a withering look. Henri flashes off a shot The camera is cabled to one of the laptops. TIGHT ON LAPTOP: The image of John pixelates onto a digit grid and a face-recognition program begins to map his fac structure. Henri turns to another laptop.
I've imputed the new search words: Daniel Jones. Big Pine Key. Sunset High School. You think of any others?
Yeah, this place sucks. 12. Henri swivels to face him.
If there's a story or picture of you on the internet, this program will find it. Our enemy doesn't know who you are -- I want to keep it that way. John nods, knows he's being a jerk.

Sand Dollar Beach, that's where we were jet skiing. Henri types it in when something SCRATCHES at the door. Their heads instantly turn towards the sound. Tense SILEN SLOW PUSH IN ON THE DOOR as another SCRATCH echoes. Henri is on his feet. He flicks off the lights and silent signals John to retreat down the hall. With the cool air an assassin, Henri unzips a duffel bag and pulls out a sl crystal-handled dagger. As he steps to the door...
... John crouches in the dark, clutching a baseball bat. Suddenly, the light in the bedroom buzzes back on. He hol his breath as the door swings open. He looks up and is relieved to see Henri.
I found our intruder -- he's a little small for a Mogadorian. At that moment,
slips between Henri's legs. It cocks its head, studies John's face, then pads forward and licks his cheek.
The dog greedily laps a bowl of milk.
He's starving, doesn't have any collar or tags.
Must have been dumped. 13.
You know, another pair of eyes and ears watching the house wouldn't be a bad thing. Henri considers the request, nods. John playfully ruffles the dog's head.
What are you going to call him?
Since I need all the luck I can get -- how about Bernie Kosar?
John enters, dressed in black, ready for his first day of school. He dumps his backpack on a chair. Henri places a plate with an omelette and perfectly browned hash browns front of him.
Wow. You outdid yourself. What's up? Henri lifts a red backpack into view. John stares at it.
I already have a backpack.
This one has five days of rations, spare clothes, cash and a handheld GPS. Keep it with you at all times.
Henri, come on.

Game's changed. You're in the crosshairs now. You have to be ready to leave at a moment's notice. With or without me. John stares at the backpack, takes in this new reality. H pushes the plate away, snatches the backpack and heads ou the door. Henri stares at the omelette, tastes a pinch of hash browns, then puts the plate on the floor on his way It takes Bernie 2.5 seconds to race over and start to eat 14.

Jack-o'-lanterns stare out from the aHALLOWEEN BLOCK PART banner strung across the red brick facade. Henri drives away. John slides the red backpack onto his shoulder when hears a FAMILIAR BARK. He turns and is surprised to find BERNIE KOSAR. The little dog is sitting by the flagpole wagging his whi tipped tail. John crosses to him, baffled.
Bernie, what the hell... were you hiding in the car? He scoops the dog into his arms.

Hey, I was about to take a picture of the little guy. John turns and finds SARAH HARTE. She's his age and is holding an old 35mm Nikon. There is something about her unforced beauty that is instantly enchanting. John shuffles, uncharacteristically nervous.
He's not supposed to be here.
Go home. Now. Bernie hops out of his arms and obediently runs towards h
He's really well-trained. How long have you had him? John turns away.
Sorry about your shot.
No worries. He begins walking towards the entrance.
You just moved into the house on Old Mill Road. It's John, right? 15. John swings back, concerned.
Don't worry, I'm not stalking you. My mom said she rented it to a guy with a son my age. Since I know every other face on this quad, that had to be you.
I'm Sarah. He nods.
Where are you from?
Someplace warmer.
I don't think that qualifies as an actual answer.
I need to register. She raises her camera to snap a shot of him.
Whoa. What are you doing?
Capturing your first day, even though you're technically six weeks late.
Please don't point that at me.
Afraid the camera's going to steal your soul? She lifts the viewfinder to her eye, adjusts focus. Annoy he covers the lens with his hand.
What's your problem? I said no.
It's only for the yearbook. John regains his composure. 16.

I'm not big into having my picture taken. Sorry. As he heads away, Sarah watches, intrigued. CAMERA TRACKS REVEAL MARK JAYNE monitoring the encounter. He's the star quarterback and his chiselled jaw tenses with jealousy.
Loaded with textbooks, John instinctively bows his head a passes the black eye of a hall security camera and steps locker. He reaches for the combination lock when

viciously sideswipes him. The textbooks scatter across th checkerboard linoleum. John sees the culprit is Mark Jayn who offers him a taunting grin. John fights his urge to react and watches as Mark struts over to his POSSE OF JOC

Welcome to Paradise, irony not included. John looks at the teen standing two lockers down. He's go battered skateboard tucked into his backpack and wears an Army surplus jacket. This is SAM GOODE -- genius by birth slacker by choice. He nods after Mark.
His name's Mark Jayne. Quarterback, sheriff's son, he's three years into the best four years of his life. John begins retrieving the fallen books. Sam helps.
Do yourself a favor -- stay off his radar.
Didn't know I was on it.
You were talking to Sarah Harte.
She was talking to me.
Mark and Sarah have been exclusive since Freshmen year. 17. John looks down the hall and sees Mark wrap his arm aroun Sarah's shoulder.
If there's another guy in her airspace, he shoots them down. You got a warning shot. John piles the books into his locker.
Maybe I'll fire back next time.

Look, you're new, so let me tell you how things work in this misnamed backwater. Football players are gods -- the rest of us are mere mortals. If you want to survive, keep your head down and don't make waves.
You sound like my dad.
Obviously a wise man.
I'm Sam by the way. Sam extends his hand. John doesn't take it.
Thanks for the download. As he SLAMS his locker shut...

It's an impressive structure with wraparound bleachers. T Junior gym class jogs around the track. John hangs in the middle of the pack, with his hoodie up, blending in. They pass the GIRLS who are stretching on the pristine fi Sarah's eyes drift towards John. The COACH blows a whistl
Alright, people. Let's hit the gym. The assembled teens GROAN and fan off towards the mouth o tunnel that stares out from the base of the bleachers. 18.
John emerges from the tunnel via a door by the stage. Som of his classmates are on the court, passing and dribbling
Okay, half court, three on three. Girls have this basket, boys have that one.

Two simultaneous games are in progress. John sits on the sidelines waiting his turn. He avoids eye contact with Sa who is sitting in the shadow of the basket. However, he d notice Mark Jayne enter and approach her.

New kid, you're up. Show me what you've got. John steps onto the court and waits for the ball to come way. He steals a glance and sees Sarah and Mark arguing. blur of orange. John swings back and catches the ball. Just as he shoots, he's distracted by Sarah's upset voice

goes wild, misses the basket but hits the glass backboard with such force that it SHATTERS. Mark and Sarah are inadvertently forced to separate as sh rain down. All eyes turn to John, who's annoyed at his momentary lapse. TEENS HOOT. The Coach BLOWS his whistle.
Enough! Hit the showers.
LeBron, grab a broom. As the gym empties, John looks over and catches Sarah watching him. OFF this silent exchange...

is clutched in Henri's hands. He heads down the hall and stops in front of the grandfather clock. Its tarnished pendulum sways. He unlocks the glass panel and slots the out of sight behind the clock's brass face. 19. Satisfied with the hiding place, he locks the front and t the key. When he turns back, he finds BERNIE KOSAR. The dog is studying him with his head cocked.
Let's keep this our little secret. OFF Bernie's inquisitive eyes...
John joins the line. He sees Sarah sitting by herself, inspecting a photographic contact sheet. His view is bloc by Sam. John rubs his hands which are oddly sweaty.
First day here and you're already destroying school property. So much for not making waves. John moves past him and grabs a tray. He's flushed and hi face is now hot and red.
It was an accident.
I hear the real spectator sport was Mark and Sarah's blowout. John wipes his brow, distracted.
Dude, you okay?
Fine. At that moment, Mark Jayne and his buddy, KEVIN, cut in f of them. Annoyed, John taps Mark on the shoulder.
You got a problem?
Line starts back there.
Football players get priority. 20.
Where's that posted?
Unwritten rule.
I'm surprised your boyfriend didn't tell you. Sam puts his hands up and backs away. Mark smirks at John
If you don't know your place around here, things can get rough. John holds his ground.

In that case, I guess I better ask you where I should sit. I was thinking about grabbing that chair next to your girlfriend. In a flash of anger, Mark whips up his tray, hammers it i John's chest, knocking him to the floor.
You want to talk trash? Let's see you back it up. John tries to stand, but is suddenly overcome with a wave pain. He looks down at his hands and is alarmed to see
blooming from his palms! He quickly balls them into fists extinguishing the light from view.
Get up! SILENCE has fallen. Still clenching his fists, John rises and stumbles out into the hall. OFF Sarah's concern as sh watches him exit...
Henri is on a ladder, adjusting a hidden surveillance cam above the front door, when Bernie starts BARKING. It's an anxious, urgent BARK. 21.

Henri steps inside and sees the dog is BARKING at -- THE GRANDFATHER CLOCK. A shaft of white light blooms from within. The shadow of swaying pendulum cuts across Henri's face. As he sprints the door...
Disoriented, John staggers down the hall. Sam catches up.
Dude, hold up! John leans against the wall, keeping his hands out of sig
You look like crap. I'll get the nurse. But as Sam runs off, John heads in the other direction.
Henri's SUV roars into view, whipping up a tornado of lea

Strips of negatives hang on drying lines. John bursts in SLAMS the door. He slips off his backpack, opens his hand TIGHT ON HIS EYES -- the brilliant light from his palms shrinks his irises to pinpricks. The luminescence is crisp, mercury-glass bright and grows stronger every second. Suddenly, the door opens. John spi in shock. A figure strides through the blinding glare, gently takes his hands and folds them into fists. IT'S HENRI. John looks at him, confusion and fear etched on his face.
Henri, what's happening to me? 22.
Calm down. You're going to be okay. John angrily holds up one of his luminescent hands.
On what planet is this okay?
Yours.
I need to get you out of here.
John steps out of the darkroom wearing Henri's heavy coat His hands are balled and stuffed into the pockets. Henri leads him quickly down the hall.
John fearfully studies his hands which have returned to normal, then looks over at Henri who seems oddly calm.
Okay, start talking. What the hell's going on?
Your first Legacy is starting to manifest.
Legacy?
An extraordinary ability. Yours is called Lumen. They start a lot sooner on Lorien. I was beginning to fear yours would never emerge.
You knew this was going to happen? Why didn't you say anything?
I didn't want to worry you. You were already under enough pressure.
I'm sorry. John acknowledges the apology, but looks at him, suspicio 23.
What else have you been hiding from me?
The curtains are drawn. Bernie Kosar dozes on the couch while John and Henri sit at the table, staring at the Box

This couldn't be opened until your first Legacy appeared. Ready? John nods nervously. Henri places the fingertips of his right hand onto five petal-shaped discs inlaid onto the l John cautiously follows suit and places his fingers on th apetalsa fanned across the opposite side.

momentarily glow and a SHARP CLICK echoes from within. Jo and Henri pull their hands away and watch as the Box miraculously comes to life. Fissures of light sweep acros the lines of inlaid stone, dividing the lid into sections that begin to twist and reform like high-tech origami.

Whoa. PUSH IN ON Bernie as he sits up and watches the Box unfol Like an intricate jigsaw, the sections finally regroup, creating a new pattern on the lid. It's a familiar geomet symbol. John touches the crystal pendant that hangs from neck -- the symbols are an exact match.
Open it. John nods, cautiously lifts the lid, revealing a neat assortment of velvet pouches and an array of colored rock They range in size and color but all share a serene beaut
What are they?
Crystals from Lorien's core. They'll guide us in your training. John tries to reach for one, but Henri slaps his hand awa 24.
Place your hand over them. John follows the instruction and is amazed when a walnut- sized crystal floats up from the Box. It slowly begins to spin and project A SWIRLING HOLOGRAPHIC GALAXY.
Our solar system. Henri points to a planet. Its oceans are dark with pollut and its sprawling continents are barren and treeless.

That's what Lorien looked like thousands of years ago. We had all the problems that Earth has today. The planet was dying until our people made a collective decision to change and slowly Lorien began to heal itself -- that's when the Legacies started. John watches as the spinning planet transforms before his eyes. Its oceans turn a vibrant chroma-key blue and the l masses become a lush emerald green.
Only a select few developed these abilities. They became known as the Garde.
That's what I am?
Like your parents and grandparents. John considers this new information.
The other children in the ship... Henri finishes John's thought.
They're Garde as well. Once you've mastered your Legacies, we'll find them and face the Mogadorians together. John looks at Henri, curious. 25.
What Legacy do you have?
I don't have any and never will. I'm your Cepan -- a teacher. My job is not just to protect you but to train you.
Give me your hand. Henri takes one of John's hands and pulls a cigarette lig from his pocket. John flinches, unsure.
Trust me. Henri flicks a flame to life and sweeps it under John's outstretched palm.
You feel that? Amazingly, the flame harmlessly licks the skin. But when Henri moves the lighter further up John's arm --
Ouch. John jerks his hand away. Henri kills the flame, shrugs.
When we're done, your entire body will be shielded against fire. John rubs his singed wrist.
You'll get other Legacies too.
Flying would be cool.
You don't get to pick them off a menu. KNOCK. KNOCK. KNOCK. As John spins to the door, the shimmering galaxy fades and the crystal drops to the floo
Mogs don't knock. 26. Henri steps to his computer bank and examines a laptop featuring live feeds from a dozen surveillance cameras he installed around the property.
It's a girl. John looks over his shoulder and reacts with surprise.
John opens the door and finds Sarah amped.
How'd you do it? Her accusation startles him.
Do what?
Eviscerate the entire senior class? She pulls a strip of overexposed 35mm film from her coat.
I was in the darkroom before lunch and they were hanging on the line smiling and looking forward to the future. When I got back, I found 15 rolls of negatives wiped clean. John shrugs innocently.
I don't know what you're talking about.
So you weren't in the darkroom today?
No.

Here's a tip. If you're going to lie, don't leave a big red backpack at the scene of the crime. She swings his backpack into view. John is mortified. He struggles to find a plausible answer and silently tries t quell the feeling welling in his chest. 27.
I don't know what happened. Maybe it's a sign that you should invest in a digital camera.

Digital sucks. Film tells the truth. Clearly, I'm not going to get that from you. He watches as she angrily heads down the steps and climbs into her car. John glances at his palms and is surprised find they are dimly luminescent.
Sarah's car sweeps out of the drive and powers towards to unaware of the truck parked in the shadows.
is behind the wheel and watches as her headlights fade in the night. OFF his simmering jealousy...
Bernie Kosar waits expectantly as Henri pours aDoggie Cho into a bowl. John steps in.
Everything okay?
She was returning my backpack. He dumps it by the door.
I think you should stay home from school for a couple of days.
I'm fine.
Just to be safe.
John lies on his bed, staring at his luminescent palms, conflicted by his emotions. 28.
Moonlight cuts across Bernie Kosar who is SNORING peacefu at the end of the bed. John tosses and turns. He finally sits up, unable to sleep.
Nursing a mug of black coffee, Henri diligently scans the laptop screens. He's clearly never gone to bed. He looks as John enters wearing track gear.
I'm going for a run. Bernie trots out and wags his tail pleadingly.
Sorry, buddy, you couldn't keep up.
EPIC AERIAL SHOT LOOKING DOWN AT AN EAGLE as it soars abo the rich kaleidoscope of trees. It almost seems to be following John, who is powering along a narrow track belo
John moves at superhuman speed, leaving a blurring wake o leaves. His foot splits a log as he bounds over it.
John charges towards a secluded stream. It's 30 feet wide He doesn't slow, leaps off the bank and effortlessly hopscotches from boulder to boulder to the other side.
It offers a high-def view of Paradise. John reaches the t and is exhilarated by the sense of temporary liberation.

alights in a nearby oak tree. John bends to tighten his laces, his eyes fall on the trio of scars branded on his ankle. His happiness dims. 29. He grits his teeth and takes off for home. As he passes t oak, the CAMERA TRACKS TO REVEAL the gecko scampering dow the gnarled trunk.
Sam is at his locker. He glances over at John's, hoping he'll show. Disappointed, he joins the crisscrossing thro

John apracticesa turning his Lumen Legacy aoffa and aona. Henri watches as John's palms glow. A  John focuses inten causing them to flare with sudden brilliance. Momentarily blinded, John jerks back and topples off his chair.

John and Sarah kneel in the shadows, then FLY BACKWARDS up through the window and INTO the burning hous REVERSE TO REVEAL the Red-Haired Teen watching playback o his FlipVideo camera, amazed. He runs to the back of the house and finds Mark. 87.
Check this out, man! PUSH IN as Mark stares at the footage, stunned.
John and Sarah walk in SILENCE, dappled in moonlight. He catches her staring at him.
Please don't look at me like that.
I'm sorry. I'm still trying to process everything I saw and I keep coming to the same conclusion -- what you did isn't possible.
It is for me.
Who are you? (off his hesitation) For once please tell me the truth. It's the hardest thing he's ever had to do.

My name isn't John. I don't have a name, just a number. 4. In fact, my whole life can be reduced to numbers: like 15 million -- that's how many light years it takes to get from my planet to Earth. 38 -- that's how many towns I've lived in. Or 3,671 -- that's how many days I've been running from an enemy that wants me dead. I lied to you, Sarah, because I lie to everyone. That's how I stay alive. Tears of relief brim as he finally reveals his soul.
I shouldn't be telling you any of this. It's dangerous. Emotionally spent, John leans against a tree. She steps towards him and brushes her hand down his cheek. 88.
I don't care. I just want to be with you.
I want that too. But if I stay you could get hurt. I have to leave to keep you safe. Sarah absorbs the bitter reality, reaches for his hand.
There's something I want to give you first.

head_text.subj: A PHOTOGRAPH OF SARAH AND JOHN

text: sharpens INTO FOCUS. It's the one Annie took of them at Thanksgiving. John and Sarah stand in the eerie red glow. She gently tongs the image into a bath of fixing solution

So you'll always remember me. With exquisite tenderness they kiss. John's palms shimmer The intensity of the luminescence builds with their risin passion. They sink to the floor and the light crescendos an ethereal flash that BLEACHES OUT THE FRAME.
The spinning lights of a trio of fire trucks FLARE THE LE CREWS hose down the last smoking embers. A DEPUTY approac Mark, who is standing by a police cruiser.
The FBI showed up flashing their badges. Wanna talk to you. As he points to a black SUV that's parked down the street
Mark climbs in the back. He looks around nervously as the vehicle starts off.
Where are we going? Is this about the fire? It was an accident. 89. Only now do we REVERSE TO REVEAL
sitting in the back. His face is masked in shadow.
We're hunting for one of the guests at your party. He holds up a netbook which flashes with the FlipVideo footage of John's rescue of Sarah. It's posted on YouTube
Do you know this boy?
Yeah, John Smith. But I didn't invite him.
He's a fugitive. We've been tracking him for some time. Mark smirks, vindicated.
I'll help you find him. He points to Sarah's image on the screen.
He's not at Sarah's, I already checked. And one of my dad's deputies drove by his house -- nada.
He poses a great threat to us. Where else could he be? Mark pulls out his cell phone.
I've got Sarah's cell number, maybe you guys can trace it? The Commander takes the phone and passes it to one of his in the front. He looks back at Mark.
Tell me everything you know about John Smith.
Sam is at the kitchen counter, watching the YouTube video his laptop, when headlights bleed through the blinds.
Sam steps out and reacts in surprise as Henri emerges thr the headlight glare.
John's not at the house. Is he here?
No, but he's all over the internet.
I know. He turns back to his SUV. Sam follows.
Those things from Warsaw -- they're coming, aren't they?
Go back inside. This isn't your fight.
The hell it isn't. I'm coming with you. OFF this declaration...
The crystal pendant glints against John's chest as he gra aParadise Higha sweatshirt from a supply closet and yanks on. Sarah's phone suddenly RINGS, startling them.
Hello. She listens, then hands John the phone.
It's Henri.
Henri careens through the night with Bernie and Sam.
Where are you?
High school.
Get out now! At that moment, all the POWER in the school DIES and the headlights of an SUV flash across the window. Fear regist in John's eyes as he realizes...
Too late... they're here.
The Commander climbs out. Mark follows but is distracted a trio of black SUVs speeds into the lot followed by a tractor trailer from which inhuman GROWLS echo.

What the hell's in there? He looks back at the Commander who is arming up from the trunk of the SUV. Mark glimpses the arsenal of future-tec machine pistols, double-bladed swords and heavy-duty dagg He backs away in fearful realization.
You guys aren't FBI. Before he can run, a Mogadorian Soldier grabs him by the and constrains him. The Commander pulls
over his broad shoulders. The cartridges are made of crys and swirl with purple light. Finally, he slips on his trademark red coat and spins towards the school.
One of John's hands holds Sarah's while the other lights their way as they hurtle down the passage. They've almost reached the doors when they suddenly fly open and
struts into view. We RECOGNIZE her as the mysterious Teen Girl. She swings up an awesome hand-cannon and FIRES righ at them. THE BLAST scorches the air between John and Sara but takes out the
who was stalking up the hall behind them! John watches in shock as the Mogadorian keels over and SHATTERS into embe John swings back to the Teen Girl as she strides forward. SHE IS NUMBER 6.
You oughta keep your heroics off the internet.
Who the hell are you?
Number 6. Where's your Cepan?
On his way. Where's yours?
Dead. The Mogs got her four months ago. We had been tracking them. She heads past. John and Sarah follow after her.
Tracking them?
We discovered they plan to attack Earth. The only thing standing in their way is the six of us. The revelation hits John like a wrecking ball.
You know what that means? John nods with new purpose.
The war starts tonight.
First we have to get out of here alive and find the others. Six leads them past the impressive trophy case. 93.
What are we up against?
There's a commander, a bunch of soldiers and two Piken. They'll have all the main entrances covered.
The gym, there's a tunnel under the stage.

It'll take us out to the stadium. Six acknowledges that info with a curt nod. FOOTSTEPS. Si grabs John and Sarah by their arms and yanks them back against the wall. They hold their breath as one of the Mogadorian Soldiers prowls straight past. He stops for a moment, then turns t corner. Sarah looks across at the mirrored trophy case an sees there's no reflection.
We're invisible. John realizes, turns to Six.
You got any other Legacies?
I can control the elements. You?

Lumen and telekinesis. More FOOTSTEPS. John turns and watches in horror as the Mogadorian Commander and a trio of Mogadorian Soldiers sw into view. The Commander is holding MARK. He is ashen with fear. Sarah has to catch herself from screaming. John makes a move, but Six holds him in place.
Stay put. They want to draw you out.
He's not dying because of me! 94. ANGLE ON THE SOLDIERS AND MARK. They're heading past the trophy case when JOHN'S VOICE booms out of nowhere.

Mark! Linoleum! Now! Mark rips free and hits the deck a second before the trop case EXPLODES. Shards of glass rip into the Mogadorians a trophies torpedo off the shelves and impale the aliens against the far wall. The Mogadorians SCREAM as they flai John, Sarah and Six break cover. John wrenches Mark to hi feet and they take off running. They dash around the next corner and find
sprinting towards them, followed by two Mogadorians! Six raises her hand-cannon, BLOWS one of the Mogs away, while John safely leads everybody into...
Barricade the doors! John telekinetically uproots a trio of bookcases that fly across the space and block the door. Sarah turns to Mark is totally shell-shocked.
What are you doing with them?
They said they were FBI. That John was a fugitive. What the hell's going on?
You've stumbled into a war. So shut up and keep your head down.
I see age hasn't mellowed your attitude, 6. Mark turns to John, guilt-wracked.
I didn't know they were trying to kill you. (genuine, to John) I'm sorry. 95.
This isn't your fault -- it's mine. He offers Mark his hand. Mark shakes it. Suddenly, Bernie begins to GROWL.
What is it, boy? Henri sees where Bernie is staring and realizes...
He's telling us to run! They take off a second before
PUMMEL-RAMS through the wall in a shower of bricks, books paper. It utters a glass-shattering ROAR. John looks back and sees Bernie bravely holding his ground.

Bernie! He watches as the beagle sprints forward and launches him at the monster. Bernie clamps onto the Piken's neck. He's hopelessly outmatched and holds on for dear life as the P tries to buck him off. Then something amazing happens -- BERNIE BEGINS TO MORPH. He doubles, triples in size and keeps growing. His featur become reptilian, gecko-like, his fur turns to spines and a matter of moments Bernie has transformed into a hulking ALIEN CREATURE. John looks to Henri as the truth of Bernie's origin dawns
Bernie's a Chimera. He came with us from Lorien.
Guess I wasn't the only one keeping secrets.
Somebody had to watch you when I wasn't around. They exit while Bernie and the Piken continue to battle. 96.
John and Henri catch up to the others.
The gym's this way. A projectile HISSES past John's ear and DETONATES a row o lockers -- BOOOOOM! -- it's like an incendiary grenade. T paint blisters off the lockers as they are consumed by FI

sees two Mogadorian Soldiers hauling heavy-duty weapons t use the glass cartridges that glow on their ammo belts. O FIRES another round. John telekinetically RIPS a door off its hinges. It flies forward, blocks the charge and IGNIT John spins back and SCREAMS --

Go! Go! Go! They take off. John follows and uses his telekinesis to fling cabinets, doors, benches anything he can to block t fiery onslaught. But the rounds are coming too fast and a projectile SMACKS him in the back. It's like being hit by napalm. As FLAMES wash across him, he looks up and snaps

that run the length of the hall. A deluge sprays, dousing the fire. With his clothes smoking, John tears around the corner. The Mogadorians charge after him, but find SIX IS WAITING. BOOOOMM! BOOOOMM! She blasts them at point-blank range. Magenta light gushes from their wounds. Like rain hitting hot coals, their bodies HISS as they crack and cinder.
Keep moving! Henri, Mark, Sarah and Sam race out of view. Then John se something emerge through the smoky, water-choked haze.
It utters a low, predatory GROWL and launches itself forw Oddly, Six doesn't move. She closes her eyes and lays one hand on the flooded floor, turning the water to

In a matter of moments, the hall has been transformed int icy tunnel. The sprinklers spray snow. The Piken struggle to find purchase in this new frozen environment and slip- slides after John and Six, who disappear into...

CRAAAAACK! The doors are DEMOLISHED as the Piken flails o the ice. It takes out a row of tables and chairs and skid to a stop. It ROARS in humiliated FURY, and its red eyes scan for John and Six who are nowhere to be seen. The Piken prowls behind the serving counter. Snow beads o its back. Its monstrous nostrils suddenly flare, sensing something. It hunches lower and peers at the trays and pa that are stored below. REVEAL JOHN AND SIX. They're invisible. John clutches Six arm. They're lying between a stack of roasting dishes. Threads of foamy drool drip onto their faces as the Piken pokes its head further. Its ghoulish red eyes seem to sta right at them. With a final frustrated SNORT, it carries
Henri, Sarah, Sam and Mark race into view. Sarah stops, panicked and afraid.
Where's John?
Right behind us. He offers her his hand. She's about to take it when
steps out of the shadows. There is nowhere and no time fo Henri and the others to run. But as the Mogadorian squeez the trigger of his hand-cannon, the wall on his right

Bernie and the first Piken crash into the hall. They are still at each other's throats and don't even notice as th steam-roller over the Mogadorian, squashing him like a bu The creatures SMASH through the opposite wall and out of sight. It's over in a violent blink.
John and Six sneak through the shadows. She steps to the door, but it won't budge. 98.
They've blocked it. Use your telekinesis.
We're not leaving without my friends.
Don't you mean the girl? John ignores the jibe and turns back. Six grabs his arm.
I broke the Elders' spell to find you. The Mogs can kill me now. We have to go.
We stay and fight. OFF his determination...
Henri and Sam crouch behind one station while Sarah and M hide in the one opposite. Henri pulls a selection of weap from the backpack. He hands one to Sam, looks over at Mar
You know how to use one of these?
My dad's the sheriff. He slides two across the floor. The door opens. They swin up to fire but find -- John and Six.
Save it for the Mogs. Let's go!

Bernie and the Piken pummel the rows of lockers which COLLAPSE like dominos. Gashed and exhausted, the battling duo SHATTER-SMASHES into THE SHOWER STALLS. Water SPURTS from a broken pipe. The Piken slips on the slick tiles. As it struggles to right itself, Bernie seiz the moment and sinks his fangs into the monster's neck.

desperately thrashes. Its talons viciously rip into Berni side. Ignoring the pain, Bernie doesn't let go until his finally jerks to stillness. As Bernie sinks to the floor, MORPHS back into a beagle and lies spent and bleeding...
John leads the group past the bleachers and points to the side of the stage.

The door's over here. The tunnel leads out to the stadium. Sarah sweeps back the curtain, revealing a padlocked set metal doors. John holds up his hand, snaps the lock and whips the chain free. The doors fly open,
spring out of the dark. One tackles Henri while the other blindsides John. Henri struggles until

The BLAST cinders the Mog's head clean off. Henri looks o and sees Mark holding a smoking shotgun and nods his than The second has John pinned when it suddenly ROARS in agon and disintegrates into a shower of sparks, revealing SIX. She sheathes her dagger and helps John up.

Saving your life. My new hobby. Sarah notices a smile of respect flicker between John and Six. PHHHHHHT! PHHHHHHT! PHHHHHHT! -- three Mogadorian knives razor the air. One impales Six in the shoulder. Sh slumps at John's feet. Henri opens FIRE on the

head_text.subj: THE COMMANDER AND TWO MOGADORIAN SOLDIERS

text: who storm towards them. John SCREAMS to Sam and Mark.
Get her down the tunnel! They grab Six by the arms and drag her into the tunnel. Sarah glances back at John and follows after them. Henri takes out a Soldier. John sweeps up his hand and 100.

head_text.subj: THE WOODEN FLOOR OPENS LIKE A ZIPPER

text: The Commander and the other Soldier are sent flying as th planks rip free of their nails. John and Henri charge int the tunnel. The doors fly shut behind them and the bleach stand rolls forward to seal the entrance.
Sarah is in the lead. Sam and Mark follow, holding the wounded Six. They've almost reached the end when
lurches into the mouth of the tunnel. Without a second's hesitation, Sam swings up his gun and BLASTS it. Mark loo at him in shock as they race through the embers. Sam shru
I play a lot of Xbox.
Sam, Mark, Six and Sarah hurtle across the field. When th reach the track, Sarah looks back and smiles with relief John and Henri burst out of the tunnel.
Don't stop! Get to the woods! She nods and exits with the others. John and Henri head onto the field after them when
leaps out of the mouth of the tunnel behind them. It's seriously pissed. It bounds straight towards John. Its fangs glint like barbed wire as it launches itself toward him. At the last second,
nobly shoves John out of the way and is plucked into the Piken's jaws. The creature shakes him like a rag doll and flings him 50 feet down the field. John watches, anguishe as Henri lands in a heap.

Nooooooooooooooooooooooooo! The Piken pivots, turns its crimson eyes on John. It almo seems to smirk. Its fangs are stained with Henri's blood. John's face hardens into a mask of rage. 101. He makes no attempt to flee as the Piken charges. As it springboards into the air... ANGLE ON JOHN'S HANDS -- as they suddenly clench. ANGLE ON THE GOALPOSTS -- as they're SNAPPED clean off th bases and fly skyward. ANGLE ON JOHN -- as the Piken's shadow washes across him. ANGLE ON THE PIKEN -- as it arcs towards John with its mo open and teeth bared. Suddenly, the goalposts spear its flanks, impaling it like supersize BBQ forks. The three-ton killing machine drops out of the sky and sm onto the 20-yard line. John watches impassively as the re life-fire dies in its eyes and its head lolls to one side
The stadium looms in the distance. Sam wrenches the dagge from Six's shoulder while Sarah and Mark anxiously watch.
John sinks by Henri's side.
Henri. Henri GROANS as John cradles his head. His coat is soaked with blood and his torso is horribly mauled. John tries t drag him to his feet.
Come on, taillights in five.
I won't be coming with you this time. Save yourself.
We go together! Henri smiles, grateful, but at that moment
flies past John and impales Henri in the chest. Henri utt a GROAN and his dying eyes meet John's.
Find the others. His voice is a GRAVELLED WHISPER. 102.

Your life is my life... always. His eyes flutter closed and he slips from John's grip. Anguished, John doesn't notice his pendant momentarily flicker with a radiant blue light. He angrily spins to fa THE MOGADORIAN COMMANDER. But in a blur of speed, the Commander steps forward, wrap his hand around John's throat and plucks him into the air He's flanked by the remaining Soldiers. John's feet kick uselessly as he's lifted face to face.
Number 4. Three Loric pendants dangle from the Commander's belt lik mocking trophies.
Your Cepan saved you on Lorien. The Commander's voice hisses with cruel certainty. He wrenches his sword from Henri's corpse.

But this moment was inevitable. The blade shimmers with silver flame as he raises it. John's eyes narrow as the sword sweeps towards him. This the moment his adolescence officially ends. This is the moment when a warrior is born. ANGLE ON BLADE as it SHATTERS into a million pieces, whic flutter to the ground like glittering confetti. John stares at the alien with calm confidence.

Nothing is inevitable. ANGLE ON JOHN'S HAND AS IT IGNITES. The flame is hotter and brighter than 10,000 acetylene torches. He grips one of the Commander's bandoliers. TIGHT ON THE MOGADORIAN'S FACE as he realizes it's over. The glass cartridges detonate in a deadly chain reaction.
John, the Commander, the Mogadorian Soldiers, in fact eve goddamn thing in the stadium is obliterated in the
that radiates across the field like a blinding ring of he
Sarah looks back as the blistering vortex of flame lights night sky. Her breath catches in her throat.
Oh my God... John. Before anyone can stop her, she takes off running, sprint for the stadium.

It's a smoking ruin. The seats have melted into puddles. Sarah bursts into view. She looks across the devastated field. The grass has been reduced to a charred black carp of stubble. Nothing remains of Henri or the Mogadorians.

John! She charges across the broiled expanse, hoping against ho Then she sees John, lying motionless and naked, his cloth completely burned away. She stops, puts her hand to her mouth to stifle a sob, when he COUGHS and stirs.
John! Ash swirls like snow as she races to his side. They wrap each other in their arms. Neither wanting to ever let go.
The sky is cracked with the first light of day. Sarah is dressing Six's wound at a table. Six winces.
Sorry, Girl Scout first aid didn't cover extraterrestrial dagger wounds. Six smiles, grateful.

Thanks. 104. As the two teens size each other up, CAMERA FINDS Mark. H hangs up his cell and crosses to John and Sam, who are talking intently by the motorcycles. John is now wearing pair of old jeans and a faded denim jacket.
The Sheriff's Department is starting to put up roadblocks. You guys better get moving. Six and Sarah join them.
You good to go?
Don't worry about me. John nods to Sam.
Sam, ride with Six.
We don't need baggage. Sam steps in front of her, determined.
I have to find out if the Mogs took my dad. Six turns to John, who is not bending, then glares at Sam
You slow us down, I'll shoot you myself. Sarah looks at John, tries to rein in her emotions.
I want to come too.
You need to stay here.
Why?
You could have died last night. I'm not putting you in danger again. Mark's promised to look after you. 105. Tears tumble down her cheeks.
I don't want to say goodbye.
I'll come back for you.
When?
When it's safe. She bows her head, anguished. He gently lifts her chin.
Where I'm from, we only give our heart to one person. I've given mine to you.
I love you, Sarah. Their lips meet and they kiss. It only ends when John hea an URGENT RUSTLE in the woods. They turn and watch as
limps into view. Blood mats his fur and his face is scratched but he's alive. OFF John's relief...

Sam sits behind Six on her motorcycle. John holds Bernie he straddles his Harley. Bernie morphs into a gecko and darts into his pocket. Sarah studies John and Six, unsure John THROTTLES the bike to life, then looks back at Sarah He fights a pang of jealousy when he sees her standing at Mark's side. RAIN spits as the motorcycles start off.

This is the first town I've left without Henri. The first one I have a reason to come back to. John and Sarah hold each other's gaze, desperately trying brand the image of their faces onto their memories.
The bikes blur past the aWelcome to Paradisea sign. 106.
He warned me the pain would be unbearable if I left her. He was right.
A straight stretch of blacktop bisects the sunbaked flatn
But I don't regret it. The pain reminds me what's at stake. A dust trail plumes as the bikes power into view.
We must find the others and face our enemy together. I'm not sure how we can stop them. But nothing is inevitable. I know that now. Thunderheads darken the horizon.
I am Number 4. His eyes are fearless and his face is undaunted by the battles yet to be fought. He's ready to face a future unmapped and uncharted. Ready. FADE OUT.
